metro

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.GameState

  • public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
    A game state is the place where all game relevant information are stored. There can only be one instance of the game state accessible by instance(). This class uses the singleton pattern to be sure that there's only be one instance at all.
    Author:
    hauke

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameState

        private GameState()
        Creates a new game state. This can't be done by an external class.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GameState getInstance()
        Returns:
        The instance of the game state. There can only be one instance per game.

      • getMoney

        public int getMoney()
        Gets the money of the player.
        Returns:
        The players money.

      • addMoney

        public void addMoney(int moreMoney)
        Add an specific amount of money to the players account. Adding a negative amount of money to the account is not permitted. May throw an IllegalArgumentException when the amount of money is less than 0.
        Parameters:
        moreMoney - The money to add/subtract. Throw an IllegalArgumentException when the amount of money is less than 0.

      • withdrawMoney

        public void withdrawMoney(int moreMoney)
                   throws NotEnoughMoneyException
        Removes the given amount of money from the bank account of the player. Passing a negative amount will add the value of it to the account (e.g. -100 will add 100$ to the account).
        Parameters:
        moreMoney - The amount of money.
        Throws:
        NotEnoughMoneyException - An exception describing that there's to less money on the bank account to withdraw the given amount from it.

      • getBaseNetSpacing

        public int getBaseNetSpacing()
        Returns:
        Gets the size of the base net spacing.

      • getToolViewWidth

        public int getToolViewWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of tool views (e.g. line- and trainView).

      • zoom

        public void zoom(int amount)
        Zooms in (makes things greater :D ) or out in by in-/decreasing the _baseNetSpacing. The minimal spacing is 20 pixel, the maximum is 70.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of steps. Each step in-/decreases the _baseNetSpacing by 5 pixel.
